Description:
SNC Lavalin's Atkins business is one of the largest multidisciplinary, multi sector engineering design consultancies in the world and is part of the SNC Lavalin Group.As one of the world’s most respected design, engineering, and project management consultancies with a leading track record in the defence sector, Atkins are ideally placed to respond to this market. We have a broad establishment and proud, 50-year history throughout the Middle East region.We provide a full range of design, engineering and project management services for buildings, transportation, and other infrastructure programmes.Acquired by SNC Lavalin in 2017, we also have an extensive depth of geographic exposure across 50 countries and breadth of 53,000 experts. As one of the largest engineering consultants, we have access to 17,000 staff in the Middle East making us one of the largest multidisciplinary consultancies in the regionRequirementsFull time degree qualified in Electrical Engineering or similar.
A minimum of 11 plus years’ in capacity as a Electrical Engineer and 15 plus years’  in capacity as a Senior Electrical Engineer with site supervision experience of working in Theme Parks and Entertaintment projectsDesirable Member of IET (or equivalent)
CEng qualification preferred
Experience in Middle East
Understanding of district cooling principalsResponsibilitiesCarry out Building Services Electrical Engineering Design on Lighting and power design to British, and local Standards.
Candidate shall have experience/worked in Theme Parks and Entertainment Complexes.
Candidate shall be experienced in handling projects using BIM models developed to 4D & 5D levels.
Candidate shall review the Contractor Model, in managing the project controls (time and budget) through 4D and 5D models.
Coordinate with Architects, Structural Engineers and Mechanical Engineers and any other design consultants.
Coordinate with, instruct and supervise Electrical Engineers and Auto CAD Technicians.
Carry out arithmetical checks and independent design checks of other Engineer’s design and design reviews.
Report to Head of the MEP Department.
Responsible for the correctness and accuracy of their own work and the work of the team. Complete engineering work within the agreed programme, or notify the Head of MEP Department if not.
Responsible for the checking of CAD works done under their supervision.
To instruct CAD operators in all project related matters.
To adhere to QA procedures and advise Engineers/Technicians.
To coordinate on a day-to-day basis for which the design of projects they have been appointed with other members of the design team.
Compile Tender Documents.
Manage Electrical project Local Authority (UPDA) DC1 and DC2 submittals.
Evaluate Contractor submittals and write reports.
Analyse problems, develop solutions.
Minute and Report writing skills.Rewards & BenefitsA competitive salary will be offered to the right candidate
Accommodation allowance
Transportation allowance
26 working days annual leave.
Medical and life insurance cover
Company gratuity scheme
Discretionary bonus scheme
